thread.author: Sarah
thread.body: Key constraint: we need to preserve Gutter's offline-first model. The CRDT should sync when peers are available but work fully offline.

thread.author: Dave
thread.body: Agreed. Yjs handles this well with its provider model â€” you can plug in WebSocket, WebRTC, or even a file-based sync.

thread.author: Mike
thread.body: This is the hard part. Comment threads are separate from the document CRDT. We might need a second CRDT for the .comments.json data.

thread.author: Sarah
thread.body: Good point. The comment marks in the document will be handled by the text CRDT, but the thread content needs its own merge strategy.
